alert.note: Alert for Corson (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 1:40PM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... Oak Creek near Wakpala affecting Corson County. .The creek level has fallen from Moderate flood stage to Minor flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Creek level has dropped from Moderate to Minor severity, flooding continues * WHERE...Oak Creek near Wakpala. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:45 PM MDT Thursday was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Friday evening by 945 PM MDT.
